comment:
Hey guys,
 

Im thinking of an e200 or e230 resale car. Most likely 2007 or 2009 yrs old. Haven test driven any yet. What do you think of the merc e classes? Is the e230 necessary? 
 

Also do merc cars hv problems generally after 5 yr mark?

Hey guys,
 

Im thinking of an e200 or e230 resale car. Most likely 2007 or 2009 yrs old. Haven test driven any yet. What do you think of the merc e classes? Is the e230 necessary? 
 

Also do merc cars hv problems generally after 5 yr mark?




E 230[W-211] is a better car,V6+7G-tronic,but higher road tax,insurance & petrol bills,the V6 engine sound nice when 'push',the earlier batch of 7G-Tronic have short lifespan,some owner hit 75Kkm,problem comes in....
If you have the budget, go for E230. V6 engine definitely much better.

If you can get hold of a 2007-2009 E280 then even lagi better.

At 231BHP and 300 Nm torque, this 3L V6 NA engine is definitely not asthmatic.
 

I understand that it has less issues too, compared to the 2.3L V6.

If you can get hold of a 2007-2009 E280 then even lagi better.

At 231BHP and 300 Nm torque, this 3L V6 NA engine is definitely not asthmatic.
 

I understand that it has less issues too, compared to the 2.3L V6.




This car is rare....
Its 2.5L btw and not 2.3 so road tax is pretty high. However, the 7 G tronic is very smooth while the 5 speed transmission often leaves more to be desired.

If road tax and petrol are non issues, definitely the 230.
 

Although not faster than the E200K, it's got a much smoother engine, much better gearbox, a lot more refined and overall really pleasant to drive in comparison. The E200K gearbox is absolutely agricultural. Any Honda gearbox feels better.

My current ride is E200AV for one half month , though the ride is slower pick-up and over-taking was a shady cow, you need to step harder to catch-up.
 

Maintenance is definitely lower & affordable as compared to BMW & Audi, and alot safer too
 

Once on the high-way, it was a breeze, The E200AV has snazzier IT, rear-view parking sensor / keyless start etc, electric seat was a plus accessories. Due to its Kompressor engine, it's roar louder from the purring engine emitting 184horse-power.
 

Could improve on leather seat to have air-con insole and softer engine refinement, the arm-rest holder where power-window switches could be accentuates to tilt at an angle to driver's finger comfort. Glove-box compartment was a wee bit smaller, lastly the floor-mat could be thicker and lush carpet for long ride up north would be a delight for tired feet.
 

The rest I cannot complain much, I think MB should do away with the symbol stand-up to be removed from the bonnet ( such a sore-thumb )
 

I chose MB due to reliability and overall ow maint. cost.

even though 2,500cc engine will incur with higher road tax, about 1,800 per year, you will love the drive. it is worth the spend.

of course, 3,000cc engine or high is even better if pockets allowed.
But at this high COE, the price is not cheap too for used E200 or E230.
get the c180 nicer
Small lah
Between these two choices, go for E230 with more power V6. The E200 slower pick up.

Thx all for the replies guys.  Is there any potential failings in the car at 4yr mark and onwards?
 

Anything i shd pay attention when checking out a used 4 yr old e class or older?

Thx all for the replies guys.  Is there any potential failings in the car at 4yr mark and onwards?
 

Anything i shd pay attention when checking out a used 4 yr old e class or older?




Most 4 yrs car can have some suspension bushes failure...for E-230,if any jerk on upshifting on the 7 speeds auto means it need repair very soon.

does C&C provide car inspection services? Say if i want to buy a car from outside, whether through dealer or private transaction, can i bring the car to C&C for them to do inspection and testing?
 

Don't tell me go STA, i know that evaluation only checks major things.

Hey guys,
 

Im thinking of an e200 or e230 resale car. Most likely 2007 or 2009 yrs old. Haven test driven any yet. What do you think of the merc e classes? Is the e230 necessary? 
 

Also do merc cars hv problems generally after 5 yr mark?



 

any car would require some parts replacement after the 5th yr~

E 230[W-211] is a better car,V6+7G-tronic,but higher road tax,insurance & petrol bills,the V6 engine sound nice when 'push',the earlier batch of 7G-Tronic have short lifespan,some owner hit 75Kkm,problem comes in....



 

it really depends on luck when getting a used car, i got my previous eclass at over 150k & drove it over 250k with no major repairs~ just regular service & wear out parts replacements every 2 mths~

My current ride is E200AV for one half month , though the ride is slower pick-up and over-taking was a shady cow, you need to step harder to catch-up.
 

Maintenance is definitely lower & affordable as compared to BMW & Audi, and alot safer too
 

Once on the high-way, it was a breeze, The E200AV has snazzier IT, rear-view parking sensor / keyless start etc, electric seat was a plus accessories. Due to its Kompressor engine, it's roar louder from the purring engine emitting 184horse-power.
 

Could improve on leather seat to have air-con insole and softer engine refinement, the arm-rest holder where power-window switches could be accentuates to tilt at an angle to driver's finger comfort. Glove-box compartment was a wee bit smaller, lastly the floor-mat could be thicker and lush carpet for long ride up north would be a delight for tired feet.
 

The rest I cannot complain much, I think MB should do away with the symbol stand-up to be removed from the bonnet ( such a sore-thumb )
 

I chose MB due to reliability and overall ow maint. cost.



 

its the bonnet mb star that makes me drives all my benz~ fyi, u can change the star to a flat cap but u may also like to change the grill to match sporty look~

You can always engage a mechanic with the 'examiner' to go with you to check the car that you are interested and they will be able to diagnose what are the underlying problems that you might face should you purchase the car, most importantly will be the gearbox transmission.
 

You pay that little amount of money but save up a lot more with the repair next time!

does C&C provide car inspection services? Say if i want to buy a car from outside, whether through dealer or private transaction, can i bring the car to C&C for them to do inspection and testing?
 

Don't tell me go STA, i know that evaluation only checks major things.



 

u may like to check if that benz is from C&C or PL~ C&C may entertain u with a fee if its from PL~ btw dont think anyone is willing to check every parts in a benz~ its gonna take over a mth i guess~

does C&C provide car inspection services? Say if i want to buy a car from outside, whether through dealer or private transaction, can i bring the car to C&C for them to do inspection and testing?
 

Don't tell me go STA, i know that evaluation only checks major things.




C&C don't do this type of service for you,"IF" you really wants to buy a better 2nd hand Mercedes,go Republic Auto[Pandan Garden],All got C&C 1 yr warranty,but price prepare to pay a bit more....but you got a peace of mind.

If you have no issue with road tax on E230, I would say : go for E280.

Either E200 or E280.
But the smaller V6[E230] is a tad smoother than its elder brother[E280],maybe piston lighter..anyway you don't need 280's power in S'pore roads.
E280's power will come in useful when cruising at NSHW.
BMW528i better

E280's power will come in useful when cruising at NSHW.




Anyway if cruising at let says 130-140km/h,not much diffrence between 230 & 280,but if going those old roads[need to overtake those lorries],280 is much better.

its the bonnet mb star that makes me drives all my benz~ fyi, u can change the star to a flat cap but u may also like to change the grill to match sporty look~

BMW high maint cost,and gear box problem always, only good thing is the high spec & comfort ride both in and out

BMW high maint cost,and gear box problem always, only good thing is the high spec & comfort ride both in and out




Not to mention Valvetronic motor and the main eccentric cam going out of phase with the cylinders' valve timing and TDC apex. Usually happens by 80-120K km for most of the Valvetronic engines.

Solution?

PML will repace the whole Valvetronic motor. Very expensive!

If road tax and petrol are non issues, definitely the 230.
 

Although not faster than the E200K, it's got a much smoother engine, much better gearbox, a lot more refined and overall really pleasant to drive in comparison. The E200K gearbox is absolutely agricultural. Any Honda gearbox feels better.



 

Agreed. Have a E200k myself , i still think accord better .

If your budget allows I would say go with the 230...I test drove the 200 and found the engine too noisy and under power + steering wheel very light feel. To cut short, I finally settled on bmw 523i xl (2007)and has been driving for 6 months now...performance and road handling both the 200 and 230 cannot match the beemer...agreed maintenace for the beemer is high but the joy driving it..umph..get a reliable and honest mechanic to maintain d car..pure joy! jus sharing my 2 cents worth...May you end up a happy owner to a new ride!

Between these two choices, go for E230 with more power V6. The E200 slower pick up.



 

E200 0-100 timing only lose out to the 230 by a fraction of a second. 
 

E200K 1.8L engine is very good.. HP not as high as the 230.. but Torque higher.. so it balances out.
 

Good in the sense no much issue lah.. rev it hard.. it tends to be noisy. The only downside of 200K is the 5 speed gearbox.. mai hiam.. still ok.. just that shift from gear to gear.. like ai mai ai mai.. NSHW.. 200+km/h.. no problem.. 
 

BMW.. last time also thinking of getting this.. but all the horror story I heard, decided on the merc for reliability

Between these two choices, go for E230 with more power V6. The E200 slower pick up.



 
 

Few months back, I went to try an E200, E230 and E280 out of curiousity.  To my surprise, the E200 delivered a better torque at lower RPM compare to the two bigger brothers. I was told by the sale man the Kompressor does a good job in pulling the car into motion at stand stil while the bigger engines are superior once up on the high way.
 

If E200 has slow pick up, E230 and E280 are even slower. However, if one is really concern about pick up, a 2.5L 523i should rule at the traffic light when comparing luxury car of the same price bracket.

I read this and couldn't help but stop laughing .... mileage and fuel consumption is definitely subjective... Ie. depends on driving style, heavy/light footed, highway/city ... whether u fetch mother-in-law everyday ... Lolsxoxoxoxo!!!
 

For everyone's benefit, it's best to advise fuel consumption by the distance travelled per a litre of fuel or just take the OBC reading loh. Don't have to be flaming ppl around right? U all drive 3-pointed stars ... surely can determine a more appropriate reply ...

Towards the end of the day, we are happy with FC, performance and all round quality by the Germans.
 

Whether 3 pointy stars Beemers, Audis or lux, it's all about car-crazy lots, we like our car and eat it too.
 

Kompressor engine are indeed louder than 7G-Tronic & CGI, but my switch from Lux was that I no longer go for speed, Niw I go for comfort and affordability, but who cares, it's still a Benz after all . . .
 

During my last 2 half months, I had changed brake-pad, serviced once and installed new front grille for a ' killer look ', of course, I owuld go for E230 V6 engine, in the end of the day, if im itching for a paint the road red, might add a chip to enhance the performance up, tis way, car has power to thrill and less road taxes to pay, downsides was to go for regular tuning & check. 
 

Happy driving . . .
